segments.text: The only one I know still love his parents.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah, that kind of went out of style didn't it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh it's not bad thing it's good thing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You know it's nice here, the air is sweet.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not sorry you came?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not sorry, no.  I can't stay here.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why not?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: For one thing your mother as much as told me to go.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [BREATHING] And then you've been kind of...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You've been kind of embarrassed ever since I got here.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I was kind of planning on sneaking up on you, you know over like a course of a week or so. They just take for granted that we're already set.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I knew they would, your mother anyway.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You did?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: From her point of view why else would I come?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: So then would you want to?  I mean I guess, you kind of have to know, maybe that's why I asked you to come.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well I guess that's why I came.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Ann, I love you.  I love you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I love you a great deal.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm sorry I don't really have much of an imagination.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Chris,
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'm sorry I'm embarrassing you, aren't I?  See, I didn't want to do it here I didn't on this porch, with this ring--I didn't want to win you away from anything.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I've been ready a long, long time.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So then he's gone.  You sure?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I almost got married two years ago.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why didn't you?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You started to write me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You felt something that far back?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Everyday since.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: why didn't you let me know?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Because I was waiting for you, Chris.  Till then you never wrote me and then when you did, well, you sure can be ambiguous you know.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh Annie, why don't you go ahead and give me a kiss, come on just a...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I kissed you.  I kissed Annie.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'll never forgive you for waiting so long.  All I did was sit around and wonder if I was crazy for thinking about you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I kissed you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Like Larry's brother.  Do what like you, Chris.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Chris, what's the matter?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Do you want to go somewhere?  Let's go.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, what is it?  Is your mother?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No, no, it's nothing like that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, then what?  You know, even in your letter you seem kind of ashamed.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't know it's--it's complicated. But it's going from me now.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You got to tell me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's kind of all mixed up with all these other things.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Wouldn't work like this.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: you know over seas I was in command of the company?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah, sure.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well I lost them.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: How many?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Pretty much all.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [BREATHING]. Geez.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Takes awhile to toss something like that off.  I mean they weren't just men, you know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: For instance, there was this one time when this kid--it had been raining for like several days and he gave me his last pair of dry socks.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: He just put it in my pocket that's the kind of guys I had.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They didn't die they killed themselves for each other and I mean that exactly, you know a little more selfish and they'll all be here today...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And I had this idea as I was watching them go down like everything was being destroyed, you know.  But I felt like this one new thing was being made, you know it's kind of like this.  This monument...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You know, that they were bringing something on to this earth, a kind of sacrifice you know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I thought I would change everything you know, and I got back here and it was- it was like nothing had changed at all...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You know.  I went to work with dad and I started that whole rat race again...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And no one had changed it was just like sort of random bus accident to them.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Driving my new car and I felt guilty you know opening my bank book seeing a new refrigerator.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: 'Cause you can take those things out of a war.  But you have to realize that those things came out of the love that a man can have for another man...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And if you can't see that then it's just loot and there's blood all over it.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I felt ashamed and I didn't want any part of it.  I guess I included you too.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Do you still feel that way?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I want you to know Annie.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: 'Cause you mustn't feel that way.  Everything you have, you have a right to...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Everything Chris do you understand that?  To me too...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: And your money there's nothing wrong in your money.  Your father put hundreds of planes into the air.  You should be proud of that a man should be paid for that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Annie...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm going to make a fortune for you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What would I do with a fortune?
segments.speaker: F
